metadata.title: CVE-2017-14992 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: Lack of content verification in Docker-CE (Also known as Moby) versions 1.12.6-0, 1.10.3, 17.03.0, 17.03.1, 17.03.2, 17.06.0, 17.06.1, 17.06.2, 17.09.0, and earlier allows a remote attacker to cause a Denial of Service via a crafted image layer payload, aka gzip bombing.

notes.note: mdeslaur> docker.io in Ubuntu doesn't appear to use the golang-github-vbatts-tar-split package during build, uses embedded one.

criterions.comment: docker.io package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '18.06.1-0ubuntu2').
golang-github-vbatts-tar-split package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.10.2-1').
